TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit HttpMethodAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Applying this attribute to an XML Web service client using HTTP-GET or HTTP-POST, sets the types that serialize the parameters sent to an XML Web service method and read the response from the XML Web service method. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If an XML Web service client calls an XML Web service method using HTTP-GET, <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute.ReturnFormatter%2A> must be set to `XmlReturnReader` and <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute.ParameterFormatter%2A> set to `UrlParameterWriter`. XML Web service clients invoking a XML Web service using HTTP-POST must set <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute.ReturnFormatter%2A> to `XmlReturnReader` and <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute.ParameterFormatter%2A> to `HtmlFormParameterWriter`.
## Examples The following example is a proxy class generated by the Wsdl.exe utility for calling an XML Web service utility using HTTP-POST. The Wsdl.exe automatically supplies the correct types for <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute.ReturnFormatter%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute.ParameterFormatter%2A>, along with specifying that the proxy class inherits from <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpPostClientProtocol>.
[!code-cs[Classic HttpMethodAttribute Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.web.services.pr_21_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[Classic HttpMethodAttribute Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.web.services.pr_21_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[Classic HttpMethodAttribute Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.web.services.pr_21_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Type returnFormatter, class System.Type parameterFormatter) cil managed

Docs.param: Initializes the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute.ReturnFormatter%2A> property to a <xref:System.Type> that deserializes the response from an XML Web service method.

Initializes the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute.ParameterFormatter%2A> property to a <xref:System.Type> that serializes parameters sent from an XML Web service client to an XML Web service method.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .
Gets or sets a <xref:System.Type> that serializes parameters sent from an XML Web service client to the XML Web service method.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Type> that serializes parameters sent from an XML Web service client to an XML Web service method. There is no default.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the XML Web service client is invoking an XML Web service method using HTTP-GET or HTTP-POST, ParameterFormatter must be `XMLReturnReader`.
## Examples The example is a proxy class generated by the Wsdl.exe utility for an XML Web service client using HTTP-GET, setting ParameterFormatter to the required value of `XMLReturnReader`.
[!code-cpp[Classic HttpMethodAttribute.ReturnFormatter Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/p-system.web.services.pr_27_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Classic HttpMethodAttribute.ReturnFormatter Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.web.services.pr_27_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic HttpMethodAttribute.ReturnFormatter Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.web.services.pr_27_1.vb)]

Docs.returns: A <xref:System.Type> that serializes parameters sent from an XML Web service client to an XML Web service method. There is no default.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a <xref:System.Type> that deserializes the response from an XML Web service method.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Type> that deserializes the response from an XML Web service method. There is no default.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the XML Web service client is invoking an XML Web service method using HTTP-GET, ReturnFormatter must be `UrlParameterWriter`, whereas a client using HTTP-POST must set ReturnFormatter to `HtmlFormParameterWriter`.
## Examples The example is a proxy class generated by the Wsdl.exe utility for an XML Web service client using HTTP-GET, setting ReturnFormatter to the required value of `UrlParameterWriter`.
[!code-cpp[Classic HttpMethodAttribute.ReturnFormatter Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/p-system.web.services.pr_76_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Classic HttpMethodAttribute.ReturnFormatter Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.web.services.pr_76_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic HttpMethodAttribute.ReturnFormatter Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.web.services.pr_76_1.vb)]

Docs.returns: A <xref:System.Type> that deserializes the response from an XML Web service method. There is no default.
